backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor for the question paper generation system, defining data types and CRUD operations for subjects, questions, generated papers, and user profiles with role-based access control via AccessControl and MixinAuthorization mixins.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping two UI restoration features (colour theme and layout/formatting) to their relevant frontend files, components, and test IDs with high confidence.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: A JSON-formatted text file containing one-sentence summaries of each frontend source file, documenting the purpose and notable fixes applied to each component, page, hook, and utility.
frontend/index.css: Global CSS file that sets up Tailwind directives and defines CSS custom property tokens for light and dark themes (background, foreground, primary, sidebar, chart colours, etc.).
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML entry point that mounts the React app into a `#root` div and loads the TypeScript module entry point `src/main.tsx`.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React application file that configures TanStack Router with an auth-guarded layout route and all page routes (Dashboard, QuestionBank, AddQuestion, GeneratePaper, PaperPreview, GeneratedPapers), wrapped in a React Query provider.
frontend/src/components/EditQuestionModa: Dialog modal component for editing an existing question, supporting text, category, difficulty, and MCQ options fields, with validation and submission via the `useUpdateQuestion` mutation hook.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Defines the main app layout with a fixed sidebar containing navigation links, user principal display, and logout functionality using Internet Identity.
frontend/src/components/PaperCard.tsx: Displays a summary card for a generated exam paper showing subject name, duration, marks, creation date, and a button to navigate to the paper preview.
frontend/src/components/PaperSection.tsx: Renders a titled section of exam questions with sequential numbering, MCQ options, and per-question mark labels.
frontend/src/components/QuestionCard.tsx: Displays a question with subject, category, and difficulty badges, and provides expand/collapse, edit (via modal), and delete (with confirmation dialog) actions.
frontend/src/components/StatsCard.tsx: A simple presentational card component that shows a statistic with an icon, title, and count value.
frontend/src/components/SubjectManager.t: Provides a UI for listing, adding, editing, and deleting subjects using React Query mutations and toast notifications.
Renders a horizontal step-by-step workflow diagram showing the five steps to generate an exam paper.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous ICP backend actor using React Query, reinitializing and invalidating dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and hook for Internet Identity authentication, managing login/logout state and persisting identity via AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for CRUD operations on subjects, questions, and related entities by calling the backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that imports fonts, configures Tailwind, and defines CSS custom properties for a navy-blue academic light/dark theme.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/AddQuestion.tsx: Page component for adding individual questions via a form or bulk-uploading questions from CSV/JSON files with validation and error feedback.
frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx: Dashboard page displaying summary stats (subjects, questions, papers) and a system workflow diagram for the exam paper generator.
frontend/src/pages/GeneratedPapers.tsx: Page that lists all previously generated exam papers sorted by creation date, with loading/empty states and a link to generate a new paper.
frontend/src/pages/GeneratePaper.tsx: Page component for configuring and generating an exam paper by selecting a subject, setting question counts per mark category, validating availability, and navigating to the paper preview on success.
frontend/src/pages/Login.tsx: Login page that authenticates teachers via Internet Identity, displaying app branding, feature highlights, and a login button with loading state.
frontend/src/pages/PaperPreview.tsx: Page that displays a generated exam paper's questions grouped by category with variant switching support and a PDF download action.
frontend/src/pages/QuestionBank.tsx: Page for browsing and filtering questions with search, subject, category, and difficulty filters, plus a tab to manage subjects via SubjectManager.
frontend/src/utils/csvParser.ts: Parses CSV text into Question objects, validating required headers and field values (category, difficulty) and collecting per-row errors.
frontend/src/utils/csvTemplate.ts: Provides a function to download a sample CSV template file with example rows covering all question categories.
frontend/src/utils/docxParser.ts: Empty file with no implemented content.
frontend/src/utils/docxTemplate.ts: Empty file with no implemented content.
frontend/src/utils/jsonParser.ts: Parses a JSON string into an array of validated Question objects, collecting per-item errors for missing fields, invalid category/difficulty values, and MCQ-specific requirements.
frontend/src/utils/pdfGenerator.ts: Generates a printable HTML exam paper from structured question sections, mapping categories to section letters/marks and rendering questions with MCQ options and mark labels.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides utility functions to read URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routes, persist them in sessionStorage, and remove sensitive params from the URL bar without reloading.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining dark mode, custom fonts (Inter, Poppins), an extended color palette using CSS variables (navy, lightblue, sidebar, semantic tokens), border radii, shadows, and keyframe animations.
project_state.json: Tracks project state for the Exam Paper Generator, recording existing features, pending fix requests, and architectural notes emphasizing that the original layout, colour theme, and PDF format must be preserved without modification.
